t: Psalm 55
To the chief Musician on Neginoth, Maschil, A Psalm of David.
Give*p ear to my prayer, O God; and hide not thyself from my supplication.
Attend*p unto me, and hear me: I mourn in my complaint, and make a noise;
Because*p of the voice of the enemy, because of the oppression of the wicked: for they cast iniquity upon me, and in wrath they hate me.
My*p heart is sore pained within me: and the terrors of death are fallen upon me.
Fearfulness*p and trembling are come upon me, and horror hath overwhelmed me.
And*p I said, Oh that I had wings like a dove! for then would I fly away, and be at rest.
Lo,*p then would I wander far off, and remain in the wilderness. Selah.
I*p would hasten my escape from the windy storm and tempest.
Destroy,*p O Lord, and divide their tongues: for I have seen violence and strife in the city.
Day*p and night they go about it upon the walls thereof: mischief also and sorrow are in the midst of it.
Wickedness*p is in the midst thereof: deceit and guile depart not from her streets.
For*p it was not an enemy that reproached me; then I could have borne it: neither was it he that hated me that did magnify himself against me; then I would have hid myself from him:
But*p it was thou, a man mine equal, my guide, and mine acquaintance.
We*p took sweet counsel together, and walked unto the house of God in company.
Let*p death seize upon them, and let them go down quick into hell: for wickedness is in their dwellings, and among them.
As*p for me, I will call upon God; and the Lord*s shall save me.
Evening,*p and morning, and at noon, will I pray, and cry aloud: and he shall hear my voice.
He*p hath delivered my soul in peace from the battle that was against me: for there were many with me.
God*p shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.
He*p hath put forth his hands against such as be at peace with him: he hath broken his covenant.
The*p words of his mouth were smoother than butter, but war was in his heart: his words were softer than oil, yet were they drawn swords.
Cast*p thy burden upon the Lord,*s and he shall sustain thee: he shall never suffer the righteous to be moved.
But*p thou, O God, shalt bring them down into the pit of destruction: bloody and deceitful men shall not live out half their days; but I will trust in thee.
